Hi,

I'm currently working on a project that has a reverse HTTP(S) proxy as=
 a central component. This proxy will shield multiple backend servers from =
direct access by clients. Currently it is planned for the reverse proxy to =
translate requests for

  https://proxy.example.com/{bakend-server}/{path} =
(1)

to

  http://{backend-server}.localdomain/{path} (2)

As you can see t=
he path of the URL is altered by the proxy.

I wonder how hypermedia can be=
 used in a RESTful way in such a setting. URIs in resource represenations f=
or a client must be in form (1). The client must not know anything about th=
e backend servers. So a resoure representation can not be in form (2). But =
a backend servers should only know about form (2).

Example:

Resource repr=
esenation as seen on a backend server:

  {"title": "some resource", "uri":=
 "http://foo.localdomain/path/for/resource"} (3)

Resource representation a=
s needed by a client:

  {"title": "some resource", "uri": "http://proxy.ex=
ample.com/foo/path/for/resource"} (4)

Where in the whole setup is represen=
ation (3) translated into form (4)
and back again?

What do you think?

Lut=
